availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bowling Green, Kentucky attorney. Nelson County, Virginia native. Attended the University of Virginia. Married Amanda M. Graham Loving on January 6, 1829. Admitted to the bar in 1829. Served in the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1840. Served in the Kentucky Senate from 1841 to 1844. Sixth Judicial District Commonwealth Attorney from 1845 to 1849. Sixth Judicial District Circuit Judge from 1849 to 1850.

bibl.p: M. Secrist, Warren County, Kentucky: History Revealed Through Biographical and Genealogical Sketches of Its Ancestors (n.p.: Lulu Press, Inc, 2013). "Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954," database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:QKJS-C67V), William V Loving and Amanda I Graham, 05 Jan 1829; citing Warren, Kentucky, United States, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond; FHL microfilm 164,003. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, District 1, p. 150.
